column4: For the first time I just downloaded Ubuntu and installed it on my old ThinkPad T30 laptop. What I am not able to figure out is how to get my wireless working.
- what kind of wireless chip do you have?
I don't know, how do I find out?
I am positive. There is even a 802.11b MAC address written on the back.
This is what I find, besides many other entries. 02:02.0 Network controller: Intersil Corporation Prism 2.5 Wavelan chipset (rev 01)
- prism usually works, but our website writer says it was flaky for him
- aptitude is a command line program
dabaR: If I run the aptitude command will it replace my gnome programs with KDE?
- better yet, it will clutter your computer with both lol
- betetr as in beter at resolving dependencies (sorry to not make that clear)
- that sounds strange since I am looking at it in my synaptic window
- I think your sources.list file is fine for downloading kubuntu-desktop
now the update manager has started and is downloading some 139 packages, so I've to wait till it finishes.
congrats, you are headed for that shining city on a hill that is KDE
